Column Comment.0: SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a data storage system, such as adatabase or XML schema.
Column Comment.1: TABLE NAME: The name of the table within the schema.
Column Comment.2: DELETION SEQUENCE NUMBER: a unique identifier for the data that has beendeleted.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: AUDIT REASON: The reason why an auditable change was made to the data, suchas data cleanup project, new data received, incorrect data corrected, missing datalocated etc.
Column Comment.5: AUTHORIZED BY BA ID: The unique identifier for the business associate whoauthorized the change to the record of data.
Column Comment.6: DELETE RECORD: a binary object in which the data values that have been deletedcan be stored. Use a format that identifies the column name and its value, such aswith XML, where the column name is the tag name.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.9: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.10: REMARK: A long description describing the information kept within the table in thePPDM schema.
Column Comment.11: RETENTION PERIOD: The length of time records or materials should be kept in acertain location or form for administrative, legal, fiscal, historical, or other purposes.Retention periods are determined by balancing the potential value of the informationto the agency against the costs of storing the records containing that information.Retention periods are often set for record series, but specific records within thatseries may need to be retained longer because they are required for litigation orbecause circumstances give those records unexpected archival value.
Column Comment.12: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.13: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.15: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.17: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
